page.title: 16NEWHAVEN TRADITIONAL CUSTOMS
page.content: Newhaven has many local customs and traditions, continued for their own value and to raise money for charity. The post of Seaford Town Crier, dating from time immemorial, has been held by Peter White since 1977. Dressed in tricorn hat, knee britches and stock, carrying bell and scroll, Mr. White regularly cries the traditional "Oyez" (meaning "listen") in Seaford and Newhaven, announcing charitable events. Newhaven Carnival Society holds an annual Firework Display and costumed procession by torchlight, a most impressive event, raising money for local charities. Another charitable custom is the Raft Race held each spring when home-made rafts race down the Ouse from Lewes to Newhaven. The ceremony, in memory of the tragic 1942 Dieppe Raid, is an annual commemoration service.
